info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 8:57AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Ouachita River At Felsenthal Lock and Dam affecting Ashley and Union Counties.
For the Ouachita River...including Felsenthal Lock and Dam... Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ouachita River at Felsenthal Lock and Dam.
* WHEN...From Tuesday evening until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 70.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding of the Felsenthal National Wildlife Refuge will continue for several days. Secondary roadways along the river bottom will be inundated and closed. At 81.0 feet, Moderate flooding of county roadways and bridges will continue for several days. Detours are necessary and travel in and around the area will be difficult.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 67.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 65.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Tuesday evening and continue rising to 82.0 feet Saturday, April 19. - Flood stage is 70.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 900 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
